p: Japanese encephalitis virus (JEV; species Japanese encephalitis virus, genus Flavivirus, family Flaviviridae) caused severe encephalitis not only in humans but also in horses and cattle ( 187). The JEV infection resulted in abortion and stillbirth in sows and aspermia and disruptions of spermatogenesis in boars ( 187). Although JEV has spread across a wide area in Japan ( 188), only a few affected cases of cattle have been sporadically recorded in Japan ( 189â€“ 193).
